intro: Alsine valentina, commonly known as Valentina's sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It produces small, white or pink flowers during the summer months. Its low-growing habit and compact foliage make it a distinctive and resilient species in its native habitat.
